coasterradio.com #715 - we stole this show
we stole this show
fri, 18 jan 2013 01:00:00 +0000
1726bc8d1a7e092839ecf8fe9b5934bd
https://sites.libsyn.com/21641/coaster-radio-com-715-we-stole-this-show

<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">imagine covering 40 different topics of discussion in a 60-minute show.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">sounds exhausting, right?</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">mike and eb will attempt to it, as they lovingly "ripoff" one of their favorite espn programs, "pardon the interruption."</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">pti is known for its fast-paced conversation, incessant bickering between the hosts and rapid-fire topics.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">the show uses a countdown timer in order to keep the conversation moving.  once the time expires, the hosts hear a buzzer and they have to move on to the next topic.  they also have an updated rundown of the show on the side of the screen.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">if coasterradio.com was a video podcast, this week's episode might look like this:</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center; font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"><a href="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-xueuwnih_ck/upibpdklgdi/aaaaaaaadsa/_8_--7wfksk/s1600/ptr_example.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="225" src="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-xueuwnih_ck/upibpdklgdi/aaaaaaaadsa/_8_--7wfksk/s400/ptr_example.jpg" width="400" style="cursor: move;" /></a></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">but even though we're an audio podcast, you get the idea.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">topics on this week's show include:</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">* doubts about cedar point's supremacy amongst theme parks</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">* universal getting into the mymagic+ game</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">* choosing the #1 flat ride in the world</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">* replacements for son of beast</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">* lou mongello being mentioned in the spiderman comic book series</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">* adults-only nights at the parks</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">* iconic rides being retired</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">* tom hanks as walt disney</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">* plus much, much more!</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">imagine covering 40 different topics of discussion in a 60-minute show.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">sounds exhausting, right?</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">mike and eb will attempt to it, as they lovingly "ripoff" one of their favorite espn programs, "pardon the interruption."</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">pti is known for its fast-paced conversation, incessant bickering between the hosts and rapid-fire topics.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">the show uses a countdown timer in order to keep the conversation moving.  once the time expires, the hosts hear a buzzer and they have to move on to the next topic.  they also have an updated rundown of the show on the side of the screen.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">if coasterradio.com was a video podcast, this week's episode might look like this:</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center; font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"><a href="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-xueuwnih_ck/upibpdklgdi/aaaaaaaadsa/_8_--7wfksk/s1600/ptr_example.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"></a></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">but even though we're an audio podcast, you get the idea.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>

<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>

coasterradio.com #710 - outlaw run and game show fun
outlaw run and game show fun
fri, 14 dec 2012 01:13:35 +0000
b25e36f79625817179db0091954fd956
https://sites.libsyn.com/21641/coaster-radio-com-710-outlaw-run-and-game-show-fun

<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">here's a trivia question for you...</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">besides walt disney, who was mike collins' hero when he was growing up?</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">the answer: bob barker from the price is right.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">mike never got to meet walt, but he did get a chance to meet mr. barker shortly after he retired from his game show.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">on this week's show, mike and eb will channel bob's spirit as they unleash a new game show... <b>theme park smarts!</b></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">coasterradio.com listeners will hear actual members of the general public answer what we consider to be <i><b>really easy</b></i> questions about amusement parks.  all the listeners will have to do is guess wheteher the person will get the answer right or wrong.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">it sounds easy... but it's much harder than you might think!</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center; font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">plus, the guys will discuss some of the new inverting wooden coasters that will be coming to american parks in 2013.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">that's right, america is getting not one, not two, but three inverting wooden roller coasters next year.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">all three are under construction right now! but which one will wow theme park guests when summer rolls around?</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">speaking of excellent rides....</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">it's time for our annual poll where we ask you guys what you think is the <a href="http://blog.coasterradio.com/2012/12/vote-for-best-new-attraction-in-2012.html"><b>best new theme park attraction</b></a> of the year.  make sure you vote between now and the end of the year.  mike and eb will be announcing the winner during the first show of 2013!</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">also on this week's show, a live trip report from disneyland's candlelight processional and much more!</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>

coasterradio.com #709 - disney dragons and haunted mansions
disney dragons and haunted mansions
wed, 05 dec 2012 20:50:49 +0000
ff9453728570b83635ce01490d87cf19
https://sites.libsyn.com/21641/coaster-radio-com-709-disney-dragons-and-haunted-mansions

<p>one of the great things about being a fan of theme parks is getting to know the creative stories and legends behind each attraction.</p>
<p>with all due respect to other theme park companies, no one does this better than disney.</p>
<p>the story and immersive atmosphere of the "haunted mansion" attractions captivate guests around the world.</p>
<p>recently, a group of filmmakers, special effects artists, composers and actors from hollywood, california created an amazing short film that brings the lore of the "haunted mansion" to life.</p>
<p>on this week's show, we interview <a href="http://dawsbrothers.com/"><b>jeremiah daws</b></a> and <a href="http://lisalivesay.net/"><b>lisa livesay</b></a> from the new short film <a href="http://missinginthemansion.com/"><i><b>"missing in the mansion."</b></i></a></p>
<p>we'll talk to them about the creative process behind the film, what is was like to shoot at disneyland during normal park hours and how fans have reacted to what they created.</p>
<p>and speaking of creative things....</p>
<p>we'll talk about the mysterious creature that has been flying in the skies over the magic kingdom this week.  curious fans have been staying up late, trying to catch a glimpse of whatever has been flying over cinderella castle each night.</p>
<p>mike and eb will break down what information is out there and possibly get the official answer to what the creature could be.</p>
<p>plus, we have a live trip report from <a href="http://canobielake.com/"><b>canobie lake</b></a> and a whole lot more!</p>
<p></p>
<p>check out all of the show notes and links in our new interactive zeen - <a data-blogger-escaped-target="_blank" href="http://zeen.com/read/qdfwnw"><b>"in styleee!"</b></a> it's brand new for season seven!</p>

coasterradio.com #708 - own the haunted mansion

fri, 30 nov 2012 01:00:00 +0000
df37502e0eacd5c0dc5286d88c6a5994
https://sites.libsyn.com/21641/coaster-radio-com-708-own-the-haunted-mansion

<p>we're about three weeks away from christmas... so now's the time to start looking for holiday gifts for family and friends.</p>
<p>or... it might be the time for you to start dropping hints about what you're interested in seeing under the tree.</p>
<p>odds are, whether you're giving or receiving, you have theme park fans in your life.</p>
<p>on this week's episode of coaster radio, we're here to help! it's the 2012 holiday gift guide!</p>
<p>the list includes everything from inexpensive stocking stuffers to obscenely expensive items that would blow someone away.</p>
<p>heck, the list includes a 7-bedroom home that looks exactly like disneyland's haunted mansion.  you can have it if you have $870,000!</p>
<p>mike and eb also talk about the possibility of park's moving to away from a once-price admission ticket to a more dynamic pricing structure based on the day of the week and the time of year.  imagine paying once price on a wednesday and a completely different price on a saturday.  could this actually happen?</p>
<p>we also have a live trip report from epcot, a few celebrity visits and details on how you can win some amazing prizes from the show!</p>
<p></p>
<p>check out all of the show notes and links in our new interactive zeen - <a data-blogger-escaped-target="_blank" href="http://zeen.com/read/flk0pd"><b>"in styleee!"</b></a> it's brand new for season seven!</p>

<p>or... it might be the time for you to start dropping hints about what you're interested in seeing under the tree.</p>
<p>odds are, whether you're giving or receiving, you have theme park fans in your life.</p>

<p>the list includes everything from inexpensive stocking stuffers to obscenely expensive items that would blow someone away.</p>
<p>heck, the list includes a 7-bedroom home that looks exactly like disneyland's haunted mansion.  you can have it if you have $870,000!</p>
<p>mike and eb also talk about the possibility of park's moving to away from a once-price admission ticket to a more dynamic pricing structure based on the day of the week and the time of year.  imagine paying once price on a wednesday and a completely different price on a saturday.  could this actually happen?</p>
<p>we also have a live trip report from epcot, a few celebrity visits and details on how you can win some amazing prizes from the show!</p>

coasterradio.com #705 - holy crap, star wars!
holy crap, star wars!
thu, 01 nov 2012 11:00:00 +0000
3ade77f79a72a37b63963ab07ad98385
https://sites.libsyn.com/21641/coaster-radio-com-705-disney-buys-lucasfilm
<p>sometimes there are big stories in the amusement industry...</p>
<p>maybe a new roller coaster is announced or a new park is being built somewhere.</p>
<p>but sometimes there are stories that come along that entirely change the landscape of the entertainment industry.</p>
<p>one of those stories happened this week.</p>
<p>the walt disney company announced that it would be purchasing lucasfilm for $4.05 billion.</p>
<p>this includes all of the star wars properties, technical companies such as industrial light and magic, lucasarts, plus anything else that george lucas created over the last four decades.</p>
<p>disney also announced that fans can look forward to star wars: episodes 7, 8 and 9, with the next installment due in 2015. (nerds rejoice!!!)</p>
<p>but what does this all mean for the disney theme parks?</p>
<p>are we going to see new attractions and themed areas based on the hundreds of characters and locations in the star wars universe?  could we see more rides based on the adventures of indiana jones?</p>
<p>or, might be actually see an entire park based on all that george lucas and his team created?</p>
<p></p>
<p>the possibilities (and the conjecture) are unlimited!!!</p>

<p>all hallows eve is almost upon us....</p>
<p>this week, we have the perfect show to get you in the "spirit" of halloween.</p>
<p>mike and eb start this week's show with a bit of talk about whether or not walt disney world and disneyland should consider an "adult-oriented" halloween event at their parks.</p>
<p>universal studios has pretty much cornered the market in orlando and southern california... but could disney come up with something even better?</p>
<p>after that, mike reveals that he has spent $199.99 on a "seance school" and wants to attempt contacting one of his heroes who has passed on to the afterlife.  will he be successful?  and who is the spirit that he wants to contact?</p>
<p>finally, after a live trip report from busch gardens tampa, the guys sit around the fire pit with their marshmellows and s'mores to begin the 2012 halloween campfire show.</p>
<p>this is an annual tradition where the guys take actual back-stories from halloween haunts across the country and bring them to life on-the-air.  you'll want to darken the room, light some candles, grab some candy (and your headsets) to join in on the fun!!!</p>

<p>the entire film was shot on location at <b><a href="http://www.conneautlakepark.com/">conneaut lake park</a></b> in pennsylvania. several of the key scenes were shot on and around classic attractions like the <a href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xbzyhe6t_6g&feature=plcp"><b>blue streak</b></a> and the <a href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=13ylbc4dlki"><b>devil's den</b></a>.</p>

<p>it's fun to visit theme parks any time of the year, but there's something a bit more special about visting them around halloween.</p>
<p>we love halloween here at the original theme park podcast!  we love it so much, that this is the first of three shows dedicated to the spookiest time of year.</p>
<p>this week's show starts out with a bit of a shocker! you'll have to listen to the first 30-seconds to see what we mean!</p>
<p>after the guys have a few minutes to process what happened, they discuss a story in the news about a man who died after partipating in a roach and worm eating contest.  the contest was very similar to what many parks do during their hallowen haunt events.  will this have any affect on what the parks do thoughout october?</p>
<p>mike and eb also talk about how kings island is selling off parts of "son of beast." is the price too high?  who would buy such a thing? and who actually came up with this idea?  the guys have answers to all of those questions.</p>

<p>on this week's episode of the original theme park podcast, we're going isolate one of those senses and focus on what you hear when riding some of the world's best theme park attractions.</p>

fri, 03 aug 2012 02:00:00 +0000

<p>as theme park fans, we've all done marathons on our favorite rides when the lines aren't long.</p>
<p>maybe we've been lucky enough to stay on our favorite roller coaster for several laps in a row on a slow day at the park.</p>
<p>but most of us haven't had to endure staying on an amusement park ride for more than 24-hours in a row.</p>
<p>on this week's show, we'll talk to robbie gibson... he's better known as "robbie the intern" on <a href="http://edmonton.virginradio.ca/shows/morningshow.aspx" target="_blank"><b>104.9 virgin radio</b></a> in edmonton, canada.</p>
<p>last week, he set the guinness world record for the <a href="http://www.guinnessworldrecords.com/world-records/2000/longest-ride-on-a-fair-groundtheme-park-attraction" target="_blank"><b>"longest marathon on a fairground/theme park attraction"</b></a> at 30 hours and 30 seconds!</p>
<p>we'll find out all about his record-setting attempt and what challenges he endured along the way.</p>

coasterradio.com #637 - the 2012 sparktacular exploosioloosa! (video)
the 2012 sparktacular exploosioloosa! (video)
fri, 29 jun 2012 00:22:11 +0000
98b7a15e2c75948339ed247e2b4ce9e6
https://sites.libsyn.com/21641/coaster-radio-com-637-the-2012-sparktacular-exploosioloosa-video

<p>we have a lot of traditions here at coasterradio.com. but one of our favorites happens every year at this time.</p>
<p>back in 2005, we shot off fireworks during the show to celebrate america's independance day. flava got the microphone as close to the sparks and flames as he could... and a tradition was born.</p>
<p>every year since, we have marked america's birthday with this colorful (and very loud) tradition.</p>
<p>a few years ago, we gave the celebration a name... the coasterradio.com sparktacular exploosioloosa!"</p>
<p>and this year, we have produced a video podcast so you can see and hear the action!</p>
<p>plus, we have fireworks footage from illuminations at epcot and fantasmic at disney's hollywood studios!</p>
<p>it's shaping up to be the greatest "sparktacular exploosioloosa' ever!</p>

review of cars land and insider park tips
fri, 15 jun 2012 01:50:00 +0000
52d4dffafc20e2038df4d2270ed1759e
https://sites.libsyn.com/21641/coaster-radio-com-635-review-of-cars-land-and-insider-park-tips
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">on the week's show, we have one of the first on-site reviews of the new cars land at disney california adventure.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">you'll hear about the rich detail of the new land as well as reviews of all three attractions!</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p><span class="apple-style-span" style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">and then we have a question for you.</span></p>
<p>if you took everyone who listened to the coaster radio podcast and put them in a giant room... what would you get.</p>
<p>eb might have a snarky comment here... but what you'd have is a huge collection of knowledge about theme parks all across the world.</p>
<p>i'd bet each of those people would have specific knowledge about certain parks they call home.</p>
<p>on this week's episode, we ask the audience to share their best tips for having a great time at their home park.</p>
<p>what rides should you visit first?  which attractions should you skip?  what food is "must-eat?" what show is "must-see?"</p>
<p>it's also fascinating to listen to all of these tips and realize how many of them apply to parks everywhere.</p>
<p>we also take a look at the story of a teenager who dressed up as a famous disney fairy while visiting  animal kingdom at walt disney world.  she was asked to change out of her costume because she looked too similar to the "real" thing.</p>
<p>who's right in this situation?  who's wrong? did the media blow this way out of proportion for ratings?  we'll get to the bottom of it all.</p>
<p>plus, we have a live trip report from coney island!</p>

<p>and, in the tradition of <b>star wars</b>, we've given this episode a very special title.</p>
<p>last week, we got into a big discussion about the relationship between george lucas and the walt disney company.</p>
<p>we wondered why disney hasn't done whatever it needs to get mr. lucas to agree to building a gigantic (potter-defeating) land or park based on the star wars empire.</p>
<p>on this week's show, we asked the coasterradio.com audience to step up to the microphone and tell us what attractions they would like to see in a disnet-built star wars park.</p>
<p>we received a lot of good answers, but any one that mentions the awesomeness that is billy dee williams gets my vote.</p>
<p>we also have a rather vocal debate with the audience about the pros and cons on on-board audio on roller coasters.  mike and eb have very entrenched feelings about the subject, but will the coasterboys be able to change their minds?</p>
<p>we'll also hear about mike's trip to pennsylvania and his visit to knoebels! did the new "black diamond"dark ride-coaster hybrid live up to the hype (and history?)</p>
<p>plus, we have a live trip report from hershey park and their new rollercoaster "skyrush" and several surprise visits!</p>
<p></p>
<p>it's all this week on the original theme park podcast!</p>

coasterradio.com #631 - verbolten at busch gardens williamsburg
verbolten at busch gardens williamsburg
fri, 18 may 2012 18:22:44 +0000
6f13602bf134f265106ddc47c58ec3c4
https://sites.libsyn.com/21641/coaster-radio-com-631-verbolten-at-busch-gardens-williamsburg
<p>on this week's show, mike heads to williamsburg, virginia to take on busch gardens' newest roller coaster - <a target="_blank" href="http://www.verbolten.com/"><b>verbolten!</b></a></p>
<p>verbolten isn't your typical roller coaster.</p>
<p>it's an immersive thematic attraction that sends passengers twisting and turning through the forbidden black forest.</p>
<p>there are a ton of great surprises and some of the most detailed theming busch gardens has ever done.</p>
<p>throughout the show, mike will describe the entire new attraction area as well as the ride itself.</p>
<p>he'll interview larry giles, busch gardens' vice president for design and engineering.  he'll tell us what it was like to take on such a massive project and what guests can expect from verbolten.</p>
<p>he'll also interview seaworld parks and entertainment's corporate director of creative development, brian morrow.  brian was responsible for the attraction's storyline and rich theming.  he'll give us the attraction's back story and tell us about some of the unique aspects of the ride.</p>
<p>plus, you'll get to ride along with mike and his brother greg as they "brave the black forest" for the first time!</p>
<p>back in indiana, eb will have the results of our weekly poll question, play a live trip report from six flags great adventure's opening day and he'll have a new clue for our soundwave contest!</p>
<p></p>
<p>it's a jam-packed all-new episode of the original theme park podcast!</p>

<p>however, there are some attractions out there that even test the courage of the bravest park fans.</p>

coasterradio.com #628 - shakespeare in love (with roller coasters)
shakespeare in love (with roller coasters)
thu, 26 apr 2012 02:20:44 +0000
59985da25bb8d1e1b7e509b6c9db0c84
https://sites.libsyn.com/21641/coaster-radio-com-628-shakespeare-in-love-with-roller-coasters-
<p>an interesting title for the podcast this week... but we'll explain it all.</p>
<p>on this episode of the "original theme park podcast," we transition from the winter months to the spring and summer and get ready for the 2012 season!</p>
<p>this week, we take a look at a recent survey conducted by six flags over georgia.  last summer, they asked their guests' opinions on different aspects of roller coasters and thrill rides.</p>
<p>you'll be surprised at what they had to say!</p>

<p>this week, we talk about all of the stories and details from our trip to disney california adventure.</p>
<p>this park has been on people's minds a lot lately as disney wraps up its major construction projects including <b>buena vista street</b> and <b>cars land</b>.</p>

coasterradio.com #621 - "reel" design contest semi-finals (part 1)
"reel" design contest semi-finals (part 1)
fri, 24 feb 2012 03:00:00 +0000
baa2cfdb6688db151f777b064a0b2948
https://sites.libsyn.com/21641/coaster-radio-com-621-reel-design-contest-semi-finals-part-1-
<p>for weeks and weeks, people from all over the world have been dreaming up new ideas for theme park attractions based on hit movies.</p>
<p>they've tried to carefully re-tell a story from a beloved film using the latest and greatest technologies available to the amusement industry.</p>
<p>some have been drawing up blueprints and schematics, others have been sketching out storyboards, while others have been writing simple paragraphs detailing their ride experience.</p>
<p>today, we find out which ideas will take their first steps on the road to super stardom.</p>
<p>today, we begin the semi-final round of the <a href="http://blog.coasterradio.com/2012/01/reel-design-contest-returns.html" target="_blank"><b>2012 "reel" design contest.</b></a></p>
<p>on this week's show, eb and mike reveal the first five semi-finalists and discuss each entry in detail.</p>
<p>what parts of the attraction concept work?  what are some things that might need to change?  could the design actually work in a real-life theme park?</p>
<p>we'll announce the next five semi-finalists on next week's show.  then, we'll narrow the top 10 entries down to three finalists.</p>
<p>those finalists will be judged by an esteemed panel of industry experts... including:</p>
<p>* neil patrick harris</p>
<p>* gary goddard, founder and ceo, the goddard group</p>
<p>* dan koch, president of holiday world and splashin' safari</p>
<p>* korey kiepert, engineer &amp; partner at the gravity group</p>
<p>* dave altman, president, american coaster enthusiasts</p>
<p>* arthur levine, theme park guide, about.com</p>
<p>* lance hart, editor of screamscape.com</p>
<p>* andre from miami, fl - the 2006 "reel" design contest winner</p>
<p>plus, we also have a live report from the disneyland resort.  apparently, there has been a disturbance outside of the terror or terror at disney california adventure. we have a live microphone on-site to get to the bottom of the situation.</p>
<p></p>
<p>all that and much more, this week on coasterradio.com!</p>

coasterradio.com #620 - the 200th episode!
the 200th episode!
fri, 17 feb 2012 03:00:00 +0000
50872dea5675ace39cea19c1739b46a0
https://sites.libsyn.com/21641/coaster-radio-com-620-the-200th-episode-
<p><i>"this is going to be a very interesting project. </i></p>
<p><i>when you first look at it, it does sound a little bit strange... you know, an entire radio show dedicated to roller coasters and theme parks.  </i></p>
<p><i> but there are shows dedicated to all types of things, like sports.  people talk for hours and hours about sports... why not talk for hours and hours about theme parks?"</i></p>
<p>this is what i said on the very first episode of our show to explain what coasterradio.com set out to be.</p>
<p> we wanted to create a fun, accessible show about theme parks and thrill rides that was for the average fan... but could also be enjoyed by even the most hardcore enthusiast.</p>
<p>back in 2005, i don't think anyone (including us) expected the show to go past 20 episodes.</p>
<p>now, here we are seven years later celebrating the 200th!</p>
<p>on this week's show, we take a look back at favorite moments from the past 199 episodes and hear from each of the "joint chiefs" who were a part of the show back in 2005.  mario, flava and greg k. return to talk about their thoughts on this milestone.</p>
<p>also, since our listeners are the heart and soul of coasterradio.com... it's fitting that we celebrate by  having our annual "listener question show" this week.</p>
<p>as per tradition, the questions are all over the map!  some are about theme parks and thrill rides, others are about pop culture and some are about mike, eb and the podcast itself.</p>
<p>we also unveil some big news about the upcoming west coast trip and count down the days to the entry deadline for the <a href="http://blog.coasterradio.com/2012/01/reel-design-contest-returns.html" target="_blank"><b>"reel" design contest!</b></a></p>
<p>thanks to each of you for listening and participating in the show. we say it several time this week, because it's the truth - you guys <i><b>are</b></i> the show... and we're thankful that you're here.<b><br /> </b></p>
<p><i>"this is going to be a very interesting project. </i></p>
<p><i>when you first look at it, it does sound a little bit strange... you know, an entire radio show dedicated to roller coasters and theme parks.  </i></p>
<p><i> but there are shows dedicated to all types of things, like sports.  people talk for hours and hours about sports... why not talk for hours and hours about theme parks?"</i></p>
<p>this is what i said on the very first episode of our show to explain what coasterradio.com set out to be.</p>
<p> we wanted to create a fun, accessible show about theme parks and thrill rides that was for the average fan... but could also be enjoyed by even the most hardcore enthusiast.</p>
<p>back in 2005, i don't think anyone (including us) expected the show to go past 20 episodes.</p>
<p>now, here we are seven years later celebrating the 200th!</p>
<p>on this week's show, we take a look back at favorite moments from the past 199 episodes and hear from each of the "joint chiefs" who were a part of the show back in 2005.  mario, flava and greg k. return to talk about their thoughts on this milestone.</p>
<p>also, since our listeners are the heart and soul of coasterradio.com... it's fitting that we celebrate by  having our annual "listener question show" this week.</p>
<p>as per tradition, the questions are all over the map!  some are about theme parks and thrill rides, others are about pop culture and some are about mike, eb and the podcast itself.</p>
<p>we also unveil some big news about the upcoming west coast trip and count down the days to the entry deadline for the <a href="http://blog.coasterradio.com/2012/01/reel-design-contest-returns.html" target="_blank"><b>"reel" design contest!</b></a></p>
<p>thanks to each of you for listening and participating in the show. we say it several time this week, because it's the truth - you guys <i><b>are</b></i> the show... and we're thankful that you're here.<b> </b></p>

coasterradio.com #616 - the birth of a theme park
the birth of a theme park
fri, 20 jan 2012 01:00:00 +0000
9a19ca093d598727a7f28c5932257e07
https://sites.libsyn.com/21641/coaster-radio-com-616-the-birth-of-a-theme-park
<p>imagine if you had a chance to sit down and talk with walt disney when he started to brainstorm about an idea called "mickey mouse park."</p>
<p>what if you could go back to 1959 and have lunch with angus wynne jr. to hear his ideas about a park that would eventually become "six flags over texas."</p>
<p>building a theme park from scratch is no easy accomplishment.  it takes hard work, a solid business plan and most importantly... a vision.</p>
<p>on this week's show, we welcome a man with a unique vision of his own.</p>
<p>he wants to see a theme park built in his home town of nashville, tennessee.</p>
<p>this week, david webb joins us to talk about his plans for <b><a href="http://www.olesouthusa.com/" target="_blank">"ole south usa"</a></b>.</p>
<p>it would be a theme park celebrating everything that is vibrant and special about the southern region of the united states.</p>
<p>david gives us a "virtual tour" of the different themed lands, including descriptions of some of their innovative rides and attractions.  he also talks about the steps being taken to make this dream a reality.</p>
<p>most importantly, he fills us in on the <a href="http://www.olesouthusa.com/index.php/theme-park/funding-levels" target="_blank"><b>pioneer club</b></a>, which gives 3,500 people a chance to take part in the birth of this theme park.</p>
<p>we also have an update on the <b><a href="http://blog.coasterradio.com/2012/01/coasterradiocom-valentines-day-charity.html" target="_blank">valentine's day charity song auction</a></b> and we announce the first coasterradio.com listener meet-up of 2012.</p>
<p>california, here we come!</p>

coasterradio.com #615 - the mysteries of universal orlando
the mysteries of universal orlando
fri, 13 jan 2012 03:00:00 +0000
897bed58c6bbad8b4e42bb18f1d942e3
https://sites.libsyn.com/21641/coaster-radio-com-615-the-mysteries-of-universal-orlando
<p>among theme park fans, one of the most talked about locations over the past several years has been <a href="http://www.universalorlando.com/"><b>universal orlando</b></a>.</p>
<p>year after year, they blow people away with their incredibly detailed and truly scary (and fun) "halloween horror nights."</p>
<p>they really turned people's heads when they unleashed the incredibly awesome <b>"spiderman"</b> attraction on the world.  some people claim that ride hasn't been topped yet.</p>
<p>then, they shocked the world when they announced plans to build <b>"the wizarding world of harry potter."</b>  what was even more amazing is that the new land and it's attractions actually lived up to the anticipation and the hype.</p>
<p>most recently, they closed <b>"jaws"</b>, one of their original opening day rides and perhaps their most iconic attraction.  that lead to speculation <a href="http://www.themeparkinsider.com/flume/201112/2824/"><b>and some controversial reporting</b></a> on what might possibly replace the gigantic amity area.</p>
<p>to make sense of all of this, we welcome <a href="http://sethkubersky.com/"><b>seth kubersky</b></a> back to the show. he is the author of <b><a href="http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/1887140948/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=utf8&tag=coasterrcom-20&linkcode=as2&camp=1789&creative=390957&creativeasin=1887140948">"universal studios 2012: the ultimate guide to the ultimate theme park.</a><a href="http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/1887140948/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=utf8&tag=coasterrcom-20&linkcode=as2&camp=1789&creative=390957&creativeasin=1887140948"><b>"</b></a></b></p>
<p><b style="font-weight: normal;">we'll talk about the recent closure of<b> "jaws"</b> and what the attraction has meant to the park's history.  we'll also talk about what it was like to be at the attraction on it's closing night.</b></p>
<p><b style="font-weight: normal;">we'll also discuss its rumored replacement.</b></p>
<p><b style="font-weight: normal;">seth will give us a breakdown about the possibility of a new harry potter themed area in universal studios florida and a new thrill attraction that would be unlike anything we have ever seen at a park before.</b></p>
<p><b style="font-weight: normal;">fascinating stuff!</b><b style="font-weight: normal;"> </b></p>
<p><b style="font-weight: normal;">plus, eb and mike announce a fun new project for all you romantics out there.</b></p>
<p><b style="font-weight: normal;">the </b><a href="http://blog.coasterradio.com/2012/01/coasterradiocom-valentines-day-charity.html"><b><b>valentine's day charity song auction</b></b></a><b> <span style="font-weight: normal;">gives listeners an opportunity to bid on an original love song that will be written especially for that special someone in your life.</span></b></p>
<p><b><span style="font-weight: normal;">and, the best part is that all of the money raised will go to the winner's favorite charity.</span></b></p>
<p><b><span style="font-weight: normal;">check out <a href="http://blog.coasterradio.com/2012/01/coasterradiocom-valentines-day-charity.html"><b>our link on the coasterradio.com blog</b></a> for more info on how to bid!</span></b></p>
<p><b><span style="font-weight: normal;"> </span></b></p>
<p><b><span style="font-weight: normal;">check out <a href="http://blog.coasterradio.com/2012/01/coasterradiocom-valentines-day-charity.html"><b>our link on the coasterradio.com blog</b></a> for more info on how to bid!</span></b></p>

coasterradio.com #613 - video podcast - christmas tree monorail!
video podcast - christmas tree monorail!
fri, 30 dec 2011 03:00:00 +0000
3d53dd695404bb77fa32af968e0f8ca8
https://sites.libsyn.com/21641/coaster-radio-com-613-video-podcast-christmas-tree-monorail-

<p>eb and mike are taking a week off for the holidays.  but, they have produced this video podcast showing you the complete circuit of mike's 2011 christmas tree monorail!</p>
<p></p>
<p>mike set up the walt disney world monorail toy under his christmas tree. two trains (yellow and black) move through a track switch and visit epcot's spaceship earth along with disney's contemporary resort and disney's polynesian resort.</p>
<p><span class="apple-style-span" style="color: #333233; font-family: arial; font-size: x-small;"></span><span class="apple-style-span" style="color: #333233; font-family: arial; font-size: x-small;"></span></p>
<p></p>
<ul id="watch-description-extra-info" style="list-style-type: none; list-style-position: initial; list-style-image: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 475px; border-style: initial; border-color: initial; background-image: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: transparent; width: 165px; min-height: 55px; border-width: 0px; padding: 0px;">
<li style="margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 1px; margin-left: 0px; padding-top: 2px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 2px; padding-left: 0px; border-style: initial; border-color: initial; background-image: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: transparent; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; border-width: 0px;"><span class="watch-likes-dislikes" style="border-style: initial; border-color: initial; font-size: 11px; background-image: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: transparent; color: #666666; line-height: 17px; border-width: 0px; padding: 0px; margin: 0px;"></span></li>
</ul>
<p></p>
<p>eb and mike are taking a week off for the holidays.  but, they have produced this video podcast showing you the complete circuit of mike's 2011 christmas tree monorail!</p>
<p></p>
<p>mike set up the walt disney world monorail toy under his christmas tree. two trains (yellow and black) move through a track switch and visit epcot's spaceship earth along with disney's contemporary resort and disney's polynesian resort.</p>
<p></p>
<p></p>

the 2011 holiday spectacular!
fri, 23 dec 2011 03:00:00 +0000
d3e9867fdb3492d5c63141c8c0010bc1
https://sites.libsyn.com/21641/coaster-radio-com-612-the-2011-holiday-spectacular-
<p>here at coaster radio, we're big fans of the <i><b>variety specials</b></i> they used to have on tv awhile back.<br /> <br /> before there were hundreds of lame reality shows and other filler, television networks used to produce special programs (especially around the holidays) that featured different kinds of entertainment and segments.<br /> <br /> this week, we're going to try to do the same thing with our <b>2011 holiday spectacular!</b><br /> <br /> this week's episode is jam-packed with fun stuff like:<br /> <br /> * a live call from main street usa at the magic kingdom from one of the show's newest correspondants.<br /> * live trip reports from christmas town at busch gardens williamsburg, a holiday fair at hyde park in  london and a roller coaster ride at gulliover's world, warrington, uk.<br /> * a "holiday kid call" from "hagrid claus" and "shapiro the elf" to two lucky children.<br /> * a dramatic (and sound effects filled) reading of "a coasterboy christmas"<br /> * interactive calls from coasterradio.com listeners<br /> * music and mayhem, plus a whole lot more!</p>
<p>we're so thankful that you listen to the show week after week and have made us a part of your lives.  we wish you and your families a happy new year!<br /> <br /> happy holidays!</p>
<p>here at coaster radio, we're big fans of the <i><b>variety specials</b></i> they used to have on tv awhile back.  before there were hundreds of lame reality shows and other filler, television networks used to produce special programs (especially around the holidays) that featured different kinds of entertainment and segments.  this week, we're going to try to do the same thing with our <b>2011 holiday spectacular!</b>  this week's episode is jam-packed with fun stuff like:  * a live call from main street usa at the magic kingdom from one of the show's newest correspondants. * live trip reports from christmas town at busch gardens williamsburg, a holiday fair at hyde park in  london and a roller coaster ride at gulliover's world, warrington, uk. * a "holiday kid call" from "hagrid claus" and "shapiro the elf" to two lucky children. * a dramatic (and sound effects filled) reading of "a coasterboy christmas" * interactive calls from coasterradio.com listeners * music and mayhem, plus a whole lot more!</p>
<p>we're so thankful that you listen to the show week after week and have made us a part of your lives.  we wish you and your families a happy new year!  happy holidays!</p>

fri, 16 dec 2011 03:00:00 +0000

<p>jim hill media published <a href="http://jimhillmedia.com/editor_in_chief1/b/jim_hill/archive/2011/12/11/why-disney-world-veterans-aren-t-expecting-to-have-a-very-merry-xpass-in-2012.aspx" target="_blank"><b>an interesting article this week</b> </a>about possible plans at walt disney world to introduce a fee-based version of the fastpass system.</p>
<p>nothing has been announced by the walt disney company as of yet, but the article says that disney is considering offering a way to reserve ride times and show/parade viewing spots if you stay at a disney resort and purchase something called "the x pass."</p>
<p>this week, the guys discuss this new possiblity and what it would mean for the theme park experience... at walt disney world and beyond.</p>
<p>the guys also take a look at the winners of the 2011 themed entertainment awards - <a href="http://www.teaconnect.org/thea-awards-0" target="_blank"><b>the thea awards!</b></a></p>
<p>the annual awards reward excellence for the creation of compelling educational, historical and entertainment projects.</p>
<p>you'll be amazed at some of the new technologies that were honored this year! and, you'll be excited to learn about an old friend of the show who won the lifetime achievement award!</p>
<p>plus, we'll have news about our gigantic holiday spectaculars that are coming up in the next two weeks!</p>

<p>with the holidays right around the corner, you might be scrambling to find the perfect gift.</p>
<p>but if you're looking for something for a theme park fan, the local mall might not have exactly what you need.</p>
<p>never fear!</p>
<p>here at coaster radio, we're bring back our annual tradition - the holiday gift guide!</p>
<p>the 2011 version has a ton of great ideas, sure to impress the theme park fan in your life.  hey, you might even want to check out some of these items for yourself.</p>
<p>plus, eb and mike get into a great debate/rant about the latest announcements from universal studios.</p>
<p>this week, we found out that hogwarts (and the incredible forbodden journey attraction) are coming to universal studios hollywood.  in addition, there were confirmed plans to expand the wizarding world of harry potter at universal orlando.</p>
<p>however, another recent annoucement had to do with the closure of the classic "jaws" attraction at universal studios florida.  the latest hot rumor is that amity island will make way for harry potter's london and phase two of the potterverse.</p>
<p>mike and eb will disect the rumors and give you their opinion on the current state of things.</p>

coasterradio.com #609 - a lost episode!
a lost episode!
fri, 02 dec 2011 03:00:00 +0000
7fcfe73ca6bdb193a41e8302ca8aaf23
https://sites.libsyn.com/21641/coaster-radio-com-609-a-lost-episode-
<p>the guys had planned on producing a regular show this week, but mike came down with a pretty bad case of the flu.</p>
<p>so, after some thought, they decided to enlist the help of clint novak from <a href="http://www.coastercrew.net/" target="_blank"><b>the coaster crew</b></a> and dig out an episode of the show that has never been heard on our podcast feed before!</p>
<p>let me explain....</p>
<p>back in 2007, after coaster radio 1.0 had gone off the air, mike, flava and mario formed a team to compete in the first ever "single riders marathon" at kennywood park.</p>
<p>now, the marathon had nothing to do with being single.  instead, it meant that each marathon rider would fill an empty seat on a coaster and complete as many laps as possible during the day.</p>
<p>people would then pledge a certain amount of money for every coaster lap counted.</p>
<p>as part of this event, flava , mario and mike produced an episode of "the coaster crew's guide to the midway" on-location at the park.</p>
<p>we thought this show was lost forever, but will holder was able to dig it up out of the archives this week!</p>
<p>so, since mike is sick, we decided to play this show for the first time ever on our podcast.</p>
<p>for all of you who have missed flava and mario... this one's for you.</p>
<p></p>
<p>for all of you who have missed flava and mario... this one's for you.</p>

coasterradio.com #607 - inspired design: from tibor to toomer
inspired design: from tibor to toomer
fri, 18 nov 2011 03:00:00 +0000
a76b8d18875cc8baddd17d5e65c98d6b
https://sites.libsyn.com/21641/coaster-radio-com-607-the-greatest-new-idea-at-iappa
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">it may be the off-season for most of us around the world, but you can get still get your park fix right here... with the original theme park podcast!</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">each year, amusement industry insiders gather at the annual iaapa conference to check out new attractions and technologies that they might want to purchase for their park.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">on this week's show, mike and eb send a wireless microphone to the 2011 iaapa show floor and talk with one specific vendor who just might have the hottest idea for the 2012 season.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">plus, the guys spend some time talking about legendary roller coaster designer ron toomer.  ron passed away during the show's hiatus this past september, so coaster radio listeners call in to talk about their favorite toomer-designed coasters. was he one of the most influential designers ever?</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">and, we'll let you in on some of the behind-the-scenes information that we gathered from our season six survey. you'll find out exactly how many women actually listen to this show.  fascinating stuff!</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">it may be the off-season for most of us around the world, but you can get still get your park fix right here... with the original theme park podcast!</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">each year, amusement industry insiders gather at the annual iaapa conference to check out new attractions and technologies that they might want to purchase for their park.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">on this week's show, mike and eb send a wireless microphone to the 2011 iaapa show floor and talk with one specific vendor who just might have the hottest idea for the 2012 season.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"></p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">plus, the guys spend some time talking about legendary roller coaster designer ron toomer.  ron passed away during the show's hiatus this past september, so coaster radio listeners call in to talk about their favorite toomer-designed coasters. was he one of the most influential designers ever?</p>

<p>welcome to the season six premiere of coaster radio!</p>
<p>eb and mike are determined to make this season the best one ever!</p>
<p>so, to kick start things off right, the guys are joined by the one and only <i><b>neil patrick harris!</b></i></p>
<p>neil is known throughout the world for his many roles in the movies, on television and on broadway.</p>
<p>but fans of coaster radio also know him as the familiar voice who introduces and ends each and every episode of the original theme park podcast.</p>
<p>on this week's show, neil joins the guys for some <span style="text-decoration: underline;"><i><b>excellent</b></i></span> theme park talk.</p>
<p>he tells the guys about how he first became fascinated with the amusement industry.  he talks about his favorite rides and attractions and what he looks for in a good ride.</p>
<p>he also talks about his "behind the scenes" involvement in some attractions and shows that you have probably experienced yourself.</p>
<p>neil looks back on the halloween yard haunt that he built in his own backyard and looks to eb and mike to give him some advice on what rides he should experience with his twin babies.</p>
<p>plus, there are a lot of other fun topics and surprises!</p>
<p> </p>
<p>this is one episode of coasterradio.com that you absolutely don't want to miss!</p>

coasterradio.com #544 - live from wiener prater!
live from wiener prater!
fri, 09 sep 2011 02:15:09 +0000
009dfea196798a8247a8730787f8f697
https://sites.libsyn.com/21641/coaster-radio-com-544-live-from-wiener-prater-

<p>we've reached the end of another season of coaster radio!</p>
<p>to celebrate, we're podcasting from one of the most unique amusement parks in the world...</p>
<p><b>wiener prater in vienna, austria!</b></p>
<p>the prater was once an imperial hunting ground and only accessible by the aristocracy,  but then, austrian emperor josef ii donated the area to the viennese in 1766 as a public leisure center.</p>
<p>since then, it has gone on to become <span style="text-decoration: underline;"><b>the place</b></span> where the people of vienna gather to relax and unwind with food, drink and wild rides.</p>
<p>that's right! in recent years, it has become home to some of the most outrageous and intensely thrilling attractions in europe!</p>
<p>join mike and eb and they talk about some of the prater's most iconic attractions - the roller coasters, ghost houses, water rides and gravity defying flat rides.  there might even be some on-ride audio from one of the oldest attractions in the park!</p>
<p> they'll also talk about how the prater is run much differently than your average amusement park and howit's full of attractions not seen many other places.</p>
<p>be sure to come back next week for the premiere of a video podcast showing off all of the rides that the guys discussed on this week's show!</p>
<p>thanks to everyone who has made this season of coasterradio.com the most successful ever! we can't wait for season six to begin in october!</p>
<p>we've reached the end of another season of coaster radio!</p>
<p>to celebrate, we're podcasting from one of the most unique amusement parks in the world...</p>
<p><b>wiener prater in vienna, austria!</b></p>
<p>the prater was once an imperial hunting ground and only accessible by the aristocracy,  but then, austrian emperor josef ii donated the area to the viennese in 1766 as a public leisure center.</p>
<p>since then, it has gone on to become <b>the place</b> where the people of vienna gather to relax and unwind with food, drink and wild rides.</p>
<p>that's right! in recent years, it has become home to some of the most outrageous and intensely thrilling attractions in europe!</p>
<p>join mike and eb and they talk about some of the prater's most iconic attractions - the roller coasters, ghost houses, water rides and gravity defying flat rides.  there might even be some on-ride audio from one of the oldest attractions in the park!</p>
<p> they'll also talk about how the prater is run much differently than your average amusement park and howit's full of attractions not seen many other places.</p>
<p>be sure to come back next week for the premiere of a video podcast showing off all of the rides that the guys discussed on this week's show!</p>
<p>thanks to everyone who has made this season of coasterradio.com the most successful ever! we can't wait for season six to begin in october!</p>

fri, 02 sep 2011 02:34:00 +0000

https://sites.libsyn.com/21641/coaster-radio-com-543-i-hope-the-breakman-isn-t-drunk-

<p>labor day weekend is here and the parks are starting to wind down from the summer season.</p>
<p>but the original theme park podcast is still going strong with an all new episode!</p>
<p>this week, we welcome back an old friend to the show!</p>

coasterradio.com #535 - our new voiceover artist - nph!

fri, 08 jul 2011 01:08:32 +0000
4068966ead30d4c5969f9affd797779c
https://sites.libsyn.com/21641/coaster-radio-com-535-our-new-voiceover-artist-nph-

<p>for each individual season of coaster radio, eb and mike like to have something called a "story arc."</p>
<p>basically, it's a common theme and storyline that can carry over throughout an entire season of the show.</p>
<p>for season four, we followed mike as he prepared for and ultimately triumphed at <a href="http://blog.coasterradio.com/2010/06/my-american-idol-experience-review-and.html"><b>the american idol experience</b></a> at disney's hollywood studios.</p>
<p>but in season five, the guys  unveiled their most ambitious "story arch" ever - <a href="http://rradio.com/2011/02/what-is-neil-patrick-harris-project.html"><b>the neil patrick harris project.</b></a></p>
<p>eb and mike wanted to have a major celebrity (who happened to love theme parks) agree to become the voiceover artist that introduces each episode of the show.</p>
<p>they locked on film, television and stage star <a href="http://www.twitter.com/actuallynph"><b>neil patrick harris</b></a>, who turned out to be a listener of the show already!</p>
<p>this week, after ten months of <a href="http://blog.coasterradio.com/2011/04/day-at-park-with-neil-contest-winner.html"><b>wacky contests</b></a>, <a href="http://blog.coasterradio.com/2010/12/coasterradiocom-510-tower-of-treats.html"><b>towers of treats</b></a> and <a href="http://www.themeparkchange.com/"><b>major charity events</b></a>, neil is ready to announce whether he will become a part of the <i><b>original theme park podcast!</b></i></p>
<p>we also welcome back an old friend, <a href="http://themeparks.about.com/"><b>arthur levine</b></a> - the theme parks guide at about.com!</p>
<p>arthur recently had a chance to ride <i><b>star tours: the adventures continue</b></i> at disneyland and <i><b>the little mermaid: ariel's undersea adventure</b></i> at disney california adventure.</p>

fri, 01 jul 2011 01:20:00 +0000

<p>we have a lot of fun traditions here at coaster radio, but one of our most cherished happens every year at this time!</p>
<p>this week, it's the 2nd annual...</p>

<p>each year, eb risks life and limb so that he can bring our wireless microphones as close as possible to the flames, sparks and explosions.</p>
<p>last year, eb got hit with a projectile wall of fire.  what could go wrong this year?</p>
<p>we also will hear from mike as he gives his "complicated" review of intimidator 305 at kings dominion.  how does it rate when compared to other rides in the park and will mike be brave enough to ever ride it again?</p>

fri, 15 apr 2011 13:11:19 +0000

<p>sometimes, the very best ideas for this crazy show of ours come from the listeners.</p>
<p>a few months ago, we were doing a show about "the best money you've spent at a park" and we received a call from <a href="http://www.deidrerodman.com/main/"><b>deidre rodman</b></a> from <a href="http://www.biddiesmusic.com/"><b>the lascivious biddies</b></a>.</p>
<p>she said the best money she spent was when she and her husband bought the "bride and groom" mickey ears to wear during their recent honeymoon at walt disney world.</p>
<p>she said that throughout the trip, they were given free food, free gifts and other special treatment from the cast members at disney.</p>
<p>when eb and i heard this, we hatched an evil plan.  we asked our listening audience for two volunteers who would go to walt disney world and pretend to be honeymooners (complete with the mickey ears) to test this theory.</p>
<p>derek and trisha from southern california answered the call and what followed was <i><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><b>"the trip of lies!"</b></span></i></p>
<p>on this week's show, we hear about their trip and find out if the hypothesis was true.  do you get tons of free stuff just for wearing "bride and groom" mickey ears?</p>
<p>plus, derek and trisha give us the scoop on the rest of their trip, including a review of the wizarding world of harry potter at universal's islands of adventure.</p>

coasterradio.com #523 - a jam-packed show!
a jam-packed show!
fri, 01 apr 2011 00:38:18 +0000
9fb47b18c53aab09de1bc116ce37494e
https://sites.libsyn.com/21641/coaster-radio-com-523-a-jam-packed-show-

<p>this week's show is so full of coaster radio goodness, it's almost enough for three whole shows!</p>
<p>there's so much going on, it's hard to decide where to begin!</p>
<p>how about we start with naming a winner in the <a href="http://blog.coasterradio.com/2011/02/day-at-park-with-neil-contest.html"><strong>"day at the park with neil"</strong></a> contest!  nph is no stranger to winning awards.  so, it's fitting that <em><strong>he calls in</strong></em> to crown a winner in our latest contest.</p>
<p>mike and eb were absolutely floored by the results.  let's just say, nph picked a darkhorse entry!</p>
<p>next, after months in the planning stages, it's finally time to officially kick off our worldwide charity event -  <a href="http://www.themeparkchange.com/"><strong>"theme park change!"</strong></a></p>
<p>the goal is to encourage theme park fans across the globe to give up one thing from the upcoming theme park season and donate the cost of that item to a worthy charity.</p>
<p>all of the proceeds from this year's event is going to an amazing organization, <a href="http://www.projectangelfood.com/"><strong>project angel food.</strong></a>  to learn more about them, the guys are joined by margaret steele, project angel food's ceo.</p>
<p>one you hear her interview, there won't be a question on whether or not you'll want to donate.  the good work this group does will make you want to reach for your wallet and join in the "theme park change."</p>
<p>please, check out the website! anyone who donates $10 or more is automatically entered into a raffle where they can win one of <a href="http://www.blogger.com/"><strong>dozens of excellent theme park prizes!</strong></a></p>
<p>and of course, we appease the coasterboys in our audience with some good, interactive theme park talk!</p>
<p>this week, we talk about specific things missing from your specific home park.</p>
<p>coasterradio.com listeners from across the world have chimed in to let us know what rides, attractions and other aspects are missing from their local theme parks.</p>
<p> </p>
<p>plus, we have a live trip report from busch gardens tampa!</p>
<p>this week's show is so full of coaster radio goodness, it's almost enough for three whole shows!</p>

<p>mike and eb were absolutely floored by the results.  let's just say, nph picked a darkhorse entry!</p>
<p>next, after months in the planning stages, it's finally time to officially kick off our worldwide charity event -  <a href="http://www.themeparkchange.com/">"theme park change!"</a></p>
<p>the goal is to encourage theme park fans across the globe to give up one thing from the upcoming theme park season and donate the cost of that item to a worthy charity.</p>
<p>all of the proceeds from this year's event is going to an amazing organization, <a href="http://www.projectangelfood.com/">project angel food.</a>  to learn more about them, the guys are joined by margaret steele, project angel food's ceo.</p>
<p>one you hear her interview, there won't be a question on whether or not you'll want to donate.  the good work this group does will make you want to reach for your wallet and join in the "theme park change."</p>

coasterradio.com #522 - party at the tower of terror!
party at the tower of terror!
fri, 25 mar 2011 00:22:24 +0000
b1ac7bcd05f919a0685faa0de5f9d34c
https://sites.libsyn.com/21641/coaster-radio-com-522-party-at-the-tower-of-terror-

<p>the <em><strong>tower of terror</strong></em> at walt disney world's hollywood studios is one of my favorite theme park attractions anywhere.</p>
<p>i love it so much, that i totally don't mind waiting in line for  it.  just being around the spooky ambiance is a thrill almost on par  with the big drop that is to come.</p>
<p>when the ride is though and i've checked out my on-ride photo and  am exiting through the gift shop, i sometimes wish that i could just  hang out there for awhile... almost as if i were a guest.</p>
<p>well, it turns out you can make this happen.  you can even have a romantic dinner just steps away from the ride's entrance.</p>
<p>on this week's show, we're joined by someone who <a href="http://disneytravelbabble.com/disney-weddings/our-wedding/tot-anniversary-party/"><strong>made this dream a reality.</strong></a></p>
<p>carrie hayward is the host of <a href="http://www.insidedisneyweddings.com/"><strong>“inside disney weddings”</strong></a> and the author of passporter's <a href="http://passporter.com/weddings.asp"><strong>“disney weddings & honeymoons.”</strong></a> </p>
<p>carrie  knows everything there is to know about the wonderful world of disney  party planning.  you'll be amazed at some of the things you can do at  walt disney world and disneyland.  you'll also be amazed at how  relatively inexpensive it is! (she'll even tell us how much it costs to  have disneyland all to ourselves!)</p>
<p>carrie will also tell  us about some of her other disney adventures... like the time she rode  the haunted mansion in florida and the haunted mansion in california in  the <a href="http://disneytravelbabble.com/trip-reports/free-dining/day-8/"><em><strong>same day!</strong></em></a> </p>
<p>make sure you check out this show and visit her website, <a href="http://disneytravelbabble.com/">disneytravelbabble.com</a>, to learn more!</p>
<p>plus, we'll have an update on the <a href="http://blog.coasterradio.com/2011/02/what-is-neil-patrick-harris-project.html"><strong>neil patrick harris project</strong></a> and next week's launch of <a href="http://www.themeparkchange.com/"><strong>theme park change!</strong></a></p>

fri, 18 mar 2011 02:51:13 +0000
051dfceec101fa1eb9174fabf9fa06e4
https://sites.libsyn.com/21641/coaster-radio-com-521-2011-listener-question-show-part-2
<p>last week's <strong>listener question show</strong> was a huge hit!</p>
<p>like all good parties, we didn't want it to end.  so, we extended the show into a second episode!</p>
<p>this  week, we answer more of your questions sent in through our blog,  facebook, twitter and our voicemail line.  plus, we take more of your  live calls... it's podcasting without a net!</p>
<p>listeners called in with a bunch of good topics and started some create discussions.  we were even surprised by a few somewhat "famous" callers.</p>
<p>this week, we also unveil our nationwide charity project...<strong> <a href="http://www.blogger.com/goog_322233424">theme park change</a></strong><a href="http://www.themeparkchange.com/">.</a></p>
<p>the event begins on april 1st and we'll have a lot more  information for you between now and then.  but basically, we're asking  theme park fans across the world to give up one thing from the upcoming  theme park season and then donate the cost of that item to a worthy  charity.  our 2011 charity for theme park change is <a href="http://www.projectangelfood.org/"><strong>project angel food</strong></a>!</p>
<p>this  event isn't just solely for coasterradio.com either.  we're inviting  any theme park fan site (disney fan sites too) to join us in raising  money for this incredible charity.</p>

<p>check  out the website and listen to this week's show to learn more!  we're  hoping you'll find it to be as good of an idea as we do!</p>

<p>we've been doing this crazy podcast since april of 2005... that's a  long time!  so, there aren't many "firsts" on the show these days.</p>
<p>but,  in an effort to continue to be one of the most interactive podcasts out  there, we're adding a new element to our annual listener question show.</p>
<p>this week, for the first time ever, we're taking your live phone calls!</p>
<p>many members of the coaster radio audience joined us during our  "live look-in" webcast where people could watch the show being  produced.  listeners were able to call-in to the show and make this  year's edition of the listener question show one of the best ever!</p>
<p>in addition to the live questions, we'll be joined by derek and  trisha, a couple in southern california who are making their way to walt  disney world in orlando next week.  they have agreed to wear bride and  groom mickey ears to test our theory that anyone wearing those "magical  caps" will get a ton of freebies (even if they aren't exactly  newlyweds!)</p>
<p>join us to find out what to expect in <em><strong>the newlywed game: the trip of lies!</strong></em></p>
<p>plus, we'll have some news on the <a href="http://blog.coasterradio.com/2011/02/what-is-neil-patrick-harris-project.html"><strong>nph project</strong></a> and an update on the <a href="http://blog.coasterradio.com/2011/02/day-at-park-with-neil-contest.html"><strong>"day at the park with neil"</strong></a> contest.  don't forget, you only have one more week to enter! the contest ends thursday, march 17th!</p>

<p>sure, we carefully outline each episode and decide what we're going to talk about weeks in advance.</p>

coasterradio.com #516 - a fantastic facebook february food frenzy
a fantastic facebook february food frenzy
fri, 11 feb 2011 01:43:31 +0000

https://sites.libsyn.com/21641/coaster-radio-com-516-a-fantastic-facebook-february-food-frenzy

<p>here at coaster radio, we try to focus our show on the entire theme park experience.</p>
<p>it's  really easy to spend time talking about the roller coasters and other  thrill rides.  but we think a little more time could be spent talking  about the 2nd best reason to go to the amusement park... <em>the food!</em></p>
<p>this  week, listeners from around the globe call in to tell us about the  iconic food treats that can be found at their local parks.  we're gonna  talk about everything from the <em>"dole whip"</em> at disneyland to the <em>"chip twister"</em> at walibi world!</p>
<p>we'll  also talk about that ice cream treat (pictured here) that looks like a  potato.  the folks at the idaho state fair know how to make a dessert!</p>
<p>we're also honored to be joined by <strong><a href="http://www.twitter.com/themeparks">dewayne bevil</a> </strong>from <a href="http://www.orlandosentinel.com/"><strong>the orlando sentinel</strong></a>.  dewayne writes for the <a href="http://blogs.orlandosentinel.com/features_orlando/"><strong>theme park rangers </strong></a>column and joins us this week to give us updates on some of the theme park projects in orlando.</p>
<p> </p>
<p>we'll talk about the proposed <a href="http://orlandoparksnews.blogspot.com/2010/12/new-orlando-thrill-park-unveils-more.html"><strong>orlando thrill park</strong></a>, <a href="http://www.orlandosentinel.com/the-daily-disney/pictures/orl-disney-world-new-fantasyland-pictures,0,7455298.photogallery"><strong>new fantasyland</strong></a> and the <strong><a href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=apj9oks0njs">cinderella castle projection show</a></strong> at the magic kingdom.  plus, we'll discuss the <a href="http://disneyworld.disney.go.com/tours-and-experiences/wild-africa-trek/"><strong>wild africa trek</strong></a> at disney's animal kindom and star wars ii.</p>
<p>we'll also have a live trip report and give away some prizes for <strong>facebook february!</strong>  are you a fan of ours on facebook yet?  you should be!  if not, <strong><a href="http://www.facebook.com/coasterradio">click here to get in on the fun!</a><span style="font-family: arial;"> </span></strong></p>
<p>here at coaster radio, we try to focus our show on the entire theme park experience.</p>
<p>it's  really easy to spend time talking about the roller coasters and other  thrill rides.  but we think a little more time could be spent talking  about the 2nd best reason to go to the amusement park... <em>the food!</em></p>
<p>this  week, listeners from around the globe call in to tell us about the  iconic food treats that can be found at their local parks.  we're gonna  talk about everything from the <em>"dole whip"</em> at disneyland to the <em>"chip twister"</em> at walibi world!</p>
<p>we'll  also talk about that ice cream treat (pictured here) that looks like a  potato.  the folks at the idaho state fair know how to make a dessert!</p>

<p>we'll also have a live trip report and give away some prizes for facebook february!  are you a fan of ours on facebook yet?  you should be!  if not, <a href="http://www.facebook.com/coasterradio">click here to get in on the fun!</a> </p>

<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">it's the one thing that separates a great park from an average amusement park.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"> </p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">that's why it was a bit of surprise when we learned that six flags would be dropping the licenses for properties like thomas the tank engine, the wiggles, tony hawk, evil kenevil and terminator.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"> </p>

<p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">happy thanksgiving!</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"> </p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">just like the pilgrims had a gigantic feast when they landed in the new world, we have a virtual feast of theme park goodness for you.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"> </p>

<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"> </p>

<p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">happy thanksgiving!</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"> </p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">just like the pilgrims had a gigantic feast when they landed in the new world, we have a virtual feast of theme park goodness for you.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"> </p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">this week, we talk about the stories behind our listener's major park disappointments.  we have tales from around the globe all about how different parks have bummed out park guests.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"> </p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">it's sort of a "reverse-thanksgiving" show!</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"> </p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">we also have a special visit from eb's pet turkey.  the turkey quickly outgrew eb's house and has moved on to a turkey farm in indiana.  just in time for the holidays, we have a heartwarming reunion with father and turkey this week.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"> </p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">plus, some news on the <a href="http://blog.coasterradio.com/search/label/neil%20patrick%20harris%20project">neil patrick harris project!</a>  don't forget to take part in our <a href="http://blog.coasterradio.com/2010/11/nph-project-holiday-wishes.html">nph holiday video!</a></p>

coasterradio.com #506 - soarin' with morgan!
soarin' with morgan!
fri, 19 nov 2010 00:07:42 +0000
c2145ae41a460bc8bda2f077e49b0efa
https://sites.libsyn.com/21641/coaster-radio-com-506-soarin-with-morgan-

<p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">imagine that you were a theme park designer with access to an unlimited budget.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"> </p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">as you began to design rides for your park, you'd probably want to enlist the help of some major celebrities to provide the voices behind your rides.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"> </p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">on this week's show, we gave our listeners a virtual blank check and asked them to match their favorite celebrity with their favorite theme park ride.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"> </p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">we received some very hilarious combinations!</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"> </p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">also, the guys will discuss <strong><a href="http://blog.coasterradio.com/2010/11/remember-you-saw-it-here-first.html">a new driving simulator from lexus</a></strong> and how it might be converted into the greatest dark ride system ever!  will we see an attraction like this within the next five years?</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"> </p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">plus, there is <strong><em>major</em></strong> news this week in <strong><a href="http://blog.coasterradio.com/search/label/neil%20patrick%20harris%20project">"the neil patrick harris" project</a></strong>.  coasterradio.com has had several milestones over the years, but the 6:43 mark in this week's show might be one of the greatest ones of all!</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"> </p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">if that doesn't make you want to take a listen, i don't know what will.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"> </p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">we also have a live trip report from a very odd spot in carowinds and one of our favorite characters makes a surprise appearance to talk sports.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;"> </p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">it's all this week on coasterradio.com!</p>
