coasterradio.com #132 - pardon the ripoff
pardon the ripoff
mon, 19 dec 2005 04:29:00 +0000
http://coasterradio.libsyn.com/index.php?post_id=41866#
https://sites.libsyn.com/21641/coaster_radio_com_132_pardon_the_ripoff
if you've every spent any time watching espn, you've probably seen a program called "pardon the interruption" (pti).  it's a daily show where washington post columnists tony kornhsiser and michael wilbon debate the the biggest stories in sports for exactly one minute at a time.
<p>
in these days of short attention spans, it's the perfect format.  so, we decided to follow the homage "imitation is the sincerest form of flattery" and do a direct rip-off of pti.  so, that's why this week's show is called "pardon the ripoff".
<p>
we'll discuss 5 different topics for exactly two minutes each.  once the buzzer sounds at the end of the two minutes, we have to move on or else eb will throw a fit.  it's the fastest theme park talk out there.
<p>
after the show, join us in our forums to talk about your opinions. you can also record your thoughts on the coasterradio.com voicemail line at 206-339-ride (206-339-7433).
<p>
also, don't forget to check out our coasterradio.com holiday gift guide.  it's filled with ideas to find the perfect gift for the theme park enthusiast in your life.  we've searched the internet for the most interesting toys, gadgets, dvds, books, calendars, posters and other gifts that are made specifically for a fan of theme parks.  we'll also found some outrageously expensive stuff that you can buy to bring the theme park experience into your home.
<p>
thanks for listening to the show.  let us know what you think by e-mailing us at feedback@coasterradio.com.

coasterradio.com #131 - the gravity group
the gravity group
mon, 12 dec 2005 03:44:00 +0000
http://coasterradio.libsyn.com/index.php?post_id=40161#
https://sites.libsyn.com/21641/coaster_radio_com_131_the_gravity_group
this year, hades, the monstrous wooden roller coaster that opened at mt. olympus water and theme park in wisconsin dells, wisconsin won the amusement today golden ticket award for best new ride in 2005.
<p>
riders were amazed by it's steep drop (140-feet at a 65-degree angle), two underground tunnels (one of which was the longest underground tunnel on a roller coaster ever), and the extreme 90-degree banked turn.  the ride was designed by the gravity group.
<p>
one of the most anticipated rides for 2006 is the voyage at holiday world and splashin' safari in santa claus, indiana.  this wooden coaster will thrill park-goers with a 154-foot drop at 66-degrees, five underground tunnels, three 90-degree banked turns and a total of 24.2 seconds of airtime.  this ride was also designed by the gravity group.
<p>
so, it goes without saying that the designers at this young company are pushing the evolution of wooden roller coasters.  we're happy to welcome gg designers korey kiepert and chad miller to coasterradio.com this week.
<p>
we'll talk to the guys about their design philosophies and how they are trying to take the development and technology of the wooden roller coaster to new heights.  we'll also talk about the pressures of designing a roller coaster in the age of the internet, where hype knows no bounds.  korey and chad will also tell us some behind-the-scenes stories about hades, the voyage and other projects that they have worked on during their careers. 
after the show, join us in our forums to talk about your opinions. you can also record your thoughts on the coasterradio.com voicemail line at 206-339-ride (206-339-7433).
<p>
also, don't forget to check out our coasterradio.com holiday gift guide.  it's filled with ideas to find the perfect gift for the theme park enthusiast in your life.  we've searched the internet for the most interesting toys, gadgets, dvds, books, calendars, posters and other gifts that are made specifically for a fan of theme parks.  we'll also found some outrageously expensive stuff that you can buy to bring the theme park experience into your home.
<p>
thanks for listening to the show.  let us know what you think by e-mailing us at feedback@coasterradio.com.

coasterradio.com #127 - building your own theme park
building your own theme park
mon, 14 nov 2005 03:23:00 +0000
http://coasterradio.libsyn.com/index.php?post_id=33498#
https://sites.libsyn.com/21641/coaster_radio_com_127_building_your_own_theme_park
if you're a theme park enthusiast, you've probably had a dream of building and owning your own theme park.  but odds are, unless you're very well connected or a multi-millionaire, you'll never get to see your dream come true.
<p>
if that isn't discouraging enough, most people would probably tell you that your dream was crazy anyway.  heck, people even told walt disney that his plans for a new type of amusement park were a horrible idea.  they even went so far as to call it "disney's folly".
<p>
but that folly eventually became disneyland and those critics had to eat their words.
<p>
so in that sprit, we welcome brian temmer to the show.  brian is a theme park fan just like all of us.  but he's doing whatever he can to bring his dream of a new type of theme park to life.
<p>
he'll give us a behind the scenes look at what it takes to push an idea like this from a dream to reality.  he'll also give us a few hints as to what this new attraction might be and where it might be located.  it's a chance for us all to watch an amusement industry project from it's conception to it's completion.
<p>

coasterradio.com #126 - extreme rides
 extreme rides
mon, 07 nov 2005 03:34:00 +0000
http://coasterradio.libsyn.com/index.php?post_id=31947#
https://sites.libsyn.com/21641/coaster_radio_com_126_extreme_rides
there really aren't many rides or attractions that theme park fans won't try at least once.
<p>
but there are a few rides out there that even the most hardcore enthusiasts think twice about before riding.
<p>
some people won't ride certain types of freefall rides while others won't ride attractions that spin you in circles.  some people won't ride skycoasters and some people could never bring themselves to ride any of the attractions on top of the stratosphere tower in las vegas.  (that picture over there on the right is x-scream.  you can read our review to find out what it's all about.)
<p>
we'll spend this week's short "off-season" show talking about the different theme park attractions that freak people out.  we'll talk about the attractions that scare us the most and we'll also hear about some of our listener's picks as well.  you'll be surprised at some of the responses we got.
<p>

<p>

<p>
thanks for listening to the show.

coasterradio.com #125 - halloween (with imagineer joe rohde)
halloween (with imagineer joe rohde)
mon, 31 oct 2005 03:16:00 +0000
http://coasterradio.libsyn.com/index.php?post_id=30411#
https://sites.libsyn.com/21641/coaster_radio_com_125_halloween_with_imagineer_joe_rohde_
all month long, we've been on-location at different theme parks celebrating halloween.  now that it's finally here, we'll spend this week's show talking about your favorite haunted, spooky or scary themed attractions.
<p> 
we'll talk about attractions like the haunted mansion, twilight zone tower of terror, the exterminator, revenge of the mummy, the beast, the freezer, burg falkenstein and more.
<p>
we're also are really excited to welcome joe rohde to the show.  joe is executive designer for walt disney imagineering and the lead designer for disney's animal kingdom theme park. since this week's show is all about mysterious attractions, it's a perfect time to ask him about expedition everest, the new thrill ride coming to walt disney world in 2006.
<p>
we'll ask him about the attraction's storyline, the immersive theming and how the legend of the yeti will come to life.
<p>
we'll also talk with joe about and how he and his team of imagineers are embarking on a real-life trip dubbed expedition everest: mission himalayas in the search for new species and ancient legends. the scientific and cultural journey to china and the eastern himalayas began in august and continues though october 2005. we'll find out how this trip to the everest region will help to create an extremely authentic experience for park guests. don't worry, we'll ask him about the roller coaster too.
<p>
we'll also talk with eb about the annual halloween extravaganza that he puts on at his house. we'll talk about the process of backyard imagineering and go into detail about the unique setup at eb's house. we'll also provide you with some links to other "home haunts" so you can get a few ideas for your own house.
<p>
after the show, join us in our forums to talk about your opinions. you can also record your thoughts on the coasterradio.com voicemail line at 206-339-ride (206-339-7433).thanks for listening to the show. let us know what you think by e-mailing us at feedback@coasterradio.com.
all month long, we've been on-location at different theme parks celebrating halloween.  now that it's finally here, we'll spend this week's show talking about your favorite haunted, spooky or scary themed attractions.
<p> 
we'll talk about attractions like the haunted mansion, twilight zone tower of terror, the exterminator, revenge of the mummy, the beast, the freezer, burg falkenstein and more.
<p>
we're also are really excited to welcome joe rohde to the show.  joe is executive designer for walt disney imagineering and the lead designer for disney's animal kingdom theme park. since this week's show is all about mysterious attractions, it's a perfect time to ask him about expedition everest, the new thrill ride coming to walt disney world in 2006.
<p>
we'll ask him about the attraction's storyline, the immersive theming and how the legend of the yeti will come to life.
<p>
we'll also talk with joe about and how he and his team of imagineers are embarking on a real-life trip dubbed expedition everest: mission himalayas in the search for new species and ancient legends. the scientific and cultural journey to china and the eastern himalayas began in august and continues though october 2005. we'll find out how this trip to the everest region will help to create an extremely authentic experience for park guests. don't worry, we'll ask him about the roller coaster too.
<p>

coasterradio.com #124 - live from fear fest at paramount's kings dominion
live from fear fest at paramount's kings dominion
mon, 24 oct 2005 01:26:00 +0000
http://coasterradio.libsyn.com/index.php?post_id=28987#
https://sites.libsyn.com/21641/coaster_radio_com_124_live_from_fear_fest_at_paramount_s_kings_dominion
this week, we're on-location from fear fest at paramount's kings dominion. it's the 3rd stop on our month-long coasterradio.com halloween terror tour.
<p>
since paramount is a movie company, kings dominion uses film-like storytelling to create their haunted mazes and attractions.  when the sun goes down, they specialize in delivering intense environments that make you scream as much as they make you laugh.
<p>
we'll talk about the evil carnie folks running amuck in freakshow in 3d, the insane residents of the maze of madness,  the carnage caused by the headless horseman in the curse of sleepy hollow and the terrifying drive you can take on r.l. stein fearstreet.
<p>
in this week's great debate, we'll talk about what horror movies would make excellent theme park rides.  then, we'll talk about new attractions coming to paramount parks in 2006.  of course, we'll highlight the new "family-thrill" coaster coming to kings dominion - italian job stunt coaster.
<p>
after the show, join us in our forums to talk about your opinions.  you can also record your thoughts on the coasterradio.com voicemail line at 206-339-ride (206-339-7433).
<p>
stay tuned, because next week we'll have another halloween-themed episode of coasterradio.com.  we'll interview joe rohde, executive designer for walt disney imagineering and the lead designer for disney's animal kingdom theme park. we'll talk with him about expedition everest, the new thrill ride coming to walt disney world next spring.
<p>
why interview joe on a halloween-themed show?  well, the new expedition everest attraction brings guests face to face with the mysterious (and terrifying) yeti!
<p>
we'll ask him about the attraction's storyline, the immersive theming and how his team of imagineers are visiting the everest region to create an extremely authentic experience for park guests.  don't worry, we'll ask him about the roller coaster too.
<p>
we'll also be revealing your picks for the best spooky/haunted/scary themed attractions at theme parks around the world.  if you want to participate, post a message in our special forum topic or leave us a voicemail message at 206-339-ride.
<p>
thanks for listening to the show.  let us know what you think by e-mailing us at feedback@coasterradio.com.

mon, 10 oct 2005 02:40:00 +0000

<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">this week, we had originally planned to bring you an on-location show from howl-o-scream at busch gardens williamsburg. it was going to be the first broadcast in our month long coasterradio.com halloween terror tour. but it was raining so hard on saturday that we and busch gardens decided it was best for the show (and our equipment) to postpone until next week.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">but luckily, kevin and beth (our correspondents from ohio) and our friends at the single serving of coke podcast got a chance to visit fear fest at paramount's kings island this weekend.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">kevin brought along his iriver mp3 recorder and recorded this week's show at pki's festhaus. kevin, beth, anthony, coke, mary and buddy talked about the atmosphere at the park, reviewed some of the most popular attractions and previewed the upcoming winterfest celebration.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">after the show, join us in our forums to talk about your opinions. you can also record your thoughts on the coasterradio.com voicemail line at 206-339-ride (206-339-7433).</p>

coasterradio.com #121 - coaster clones
coaster clones
sun, 02 oct 2005 23:09:00 +0000
c332f441e4412fd9ae428c5fb9d58602
https://dts.podtrac.com/redirect.mp3/pscrb.fm/rss/p/traffic.libsyn.com/secure/coasterradio/coasterradio_121.mp3
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">have you ever been riding on a roller coaster for the first time and sworn that you've ridden it before? it probably wasn't deja vu (the feeling, not the coaster).</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">most likely, you were riding an exact duplicate of a roller coaster from another park. you were probably riding a coaster clone. (actually, the roller coaster deja vu is a coaster clone!)</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">sometimes if a theme park or a ride designer has a proven coaster design on their hands, it's less expensive for the parks to build more of the same instead of paying for new design. the general public hardly cares, but the important question is... do theme park enthusiasts care?</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">after the show, join us in our forums to talk about your opinions. you can also record your thoughts on the coasterradio.com voicemail line at 206-339-ride (206-339-7433).</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">stay tuned, because next week we're recording the show live at busch gardens williamsburg's annual halloween event - howl-o-scream! we'll tell you all about the haunted attractions and shows as well as talk with park guests about the event.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">thanks for listening to the show. let us know what you think by e-mailing us at feedback@coasterradio.com.</p>

coasterradio.com #120 - theme park dating
theme park dating
sun, 25 sep 2005 21:56:00 +0000
c25fa3f64463b64dcc00731c10fdc4f4
https://dts.podtrac.com/redirect.mp3/pscrb.fm/rss/p/traffic.libsyn.com/secure/coasterradio/coasterradio_120.mp3
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">theme parks are a great place for families and friends to get together and have a good time. they're fun, loud, colorful and exciting.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">but are they romantic?</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">this week, we'll talk about whether or not theme parks are a good place to start up a romantic relationship. when you think about it, there are plenty of similarities between a theme park trip and an average date. instead of having awkward conversation over dinner, you can have awkward conversation while standing in a line. instead of holding hands while watching the latest thriller from wes craven, you can hold hands while you ride the latest thriller from b and m. (ok, that was totally lame. but you get my drift.)</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">after the show, join us in our forums to talk about your opinions. you can also record your thoughts on the coasterradio.com voicemail line at 206-339-ride (206-339-7433).</p>

<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">thanks for listening to the show. let us know what you think by e-mailing us at feedback@coasterradio.com.</p>

coasterradio.com #117 - listener controlled show
listener controlled show
sun, 28 aug 2005 18:13:00 +0000
167925e870bc1515a23bb79a2784f1ed
https://dts.podtrac.com/redirect.mp3/pscrb.fm/rss/p/traffic.libsyn.com/secure/coasterradio/coasterradio_117.mp3
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">as we wind down the 2005 summer theme park season, we wanted to do something special for the thousands of you who listen each week.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">we decided to put you in charge of this week's show.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">over the past few months, we've received hundredsof e-mails and forum postings from listeners all over the world who want us to talk about specific topics. since there isn't time to get to all of them during our regular podcasts, we decided that we would use the show before our summer season finale to answer as many as we could.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">this week, we'll answer your e-mails about cedar point, looping water slides, on-ride video replacing on-ride photos, smoke-free parks, and annoying park guests. we'll also answer some of your questions about the show itself. have you ever wanted to know the types of things e.b. says that eventually get cut out of the final show? well, this might be the show where we tell you. we'll also give you some behind the scenes info about how the podcast is created.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">next week is our summer season finale. we'll be presenting the 2005 coasterradio.com awards! it will be a star-studded event live from the coasterradio.com amphitheater in washington, dc.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">by the way, some of you have asked if we will be going away and not producing new shows during the fall and winter. that was the plan originally, but now we're all set to produce one regular show a month and then produce shorter 5-to-10 minute shows during the other weeks. we're planning on getting a lot of input from our listeners to make those shows interesting.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">so we hope to hear from you though e-mail, through our forums and on the coasterradio.com voicemail line at 206-339-ride (206-339-7433).</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">thanks for listening!</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">as we wind down the 2005 summer theme park season, we wanted to do something special for the thousands of you who listen each week.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">we decided to put you in charge of this week's show.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">over the past few months, we've received hundredsof e-mails and forum postings from listeners all over the world who want us to talk about specific topics. since there isn't time to get to all of them during our regular podcasts, we decided that we would use the show before our summer season finale to answer as many as we could.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">this week, we'll answer your e-mails about cedar point, looping water slides, on-ride video replacing on-ride photos, smoke-free parks, and annoying park guests. we'll also answer some of your questions about the show itself. have you ever wanted to know the types of things e.b. says that eventually get cut out of the final show? well, this might be the show where we tell you. we'll also give you some behind the scenes info about how the podcast is created.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">next week is our summer season finale. we'll be presenting the 2005 coasterradio.com awards! it will be a star-studded event live from the coasterradio.com amphitheater in washington, dc.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">by the way, some of you have asked if we will be going away and not producing new shows during the fall and winter. that was the plan originally, but now we're all set to produce one regular show a month and then produce shorter 5-to-10 minute shows during the other weeks. we're planning on getting a lot of input from our listeners to make those shows interesting.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">so we hope to hear from you though e-mail, through our forums and on the coasterradio.com voicemail line at 206-339-ride (206-339-7433).</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">thanks for listening!</p>

coasterradio.com #116 - independent parks
independent parks
sun, 21 aug 2005 18:10:00 +0000
ce8cd1915659ca71759cd4ec48ac7b31
https://dts.podtrac.com/redirect.mp3/pscrb.fm/rss/p/traffic.libsyn.com/secure/coasterradio/coasterradio_116.mp3
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">if you're a theme park enthusiast, you definitely know names like disney, universal, six flags, paramount, busch and cedar fair.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">they are the companies behind the major theme park chains in the united states. they also account for most of the profit made in the amusement park industry.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">however, when it comes to customer service, cleanliness and value, most of those parks can't compete with america's independent parks.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">there are dozens of family-owned parks that strive to give their guests a feeling of welcome and the knowledge that their park is a place people can call home.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">parks like kennywood, knoebels, indiana beach, lake compounce and holiday world are excellent examples of parks that are known throughout the world for their hospitality, attentive staff and a collection of rides that vary from classic to modern.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">on this week's show, we'll talk about many of these parks and how they differ from the corporate themers. we give specific details about prices, attractions and the unique aspects of each park.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">we'll also be joined by will koch, the president of holiday world & splashin' safari in santa claus indiana.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">holiday world is recognized as an industry leader because of their innovations in hospitality and the overall guest experience. they shocked the amusement park industry a few years ago when they began giving way free soft drinks as part of the regular admission fee.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">they also are home to the raven and the legend, two of the top wooden roller coasters in the world.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">we'll talk with will about the the family history of holiday world, the secret behind its success, and we'll find out as much as we can about their new record-breaking wooden coaster for 2006 - the voyage. we'll also tell you who won our soundwave contest and we'll have another edition of theme park trivia.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">next week, we're putting you in charge of the show. head to our dedicated forum topic to let us know what you want to hear. it's our way of saying thanks for listening to the show in 2005.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">don't forget to vote in our 2005 coasterradio.com awards!</p>

coasterradio.com #115 - orlando: beyond the mouse
orlando: beyond the mouse
mon, 15 aug 2005 00:17:00 +0000
b838ca7d35d46b71dbcea6eeece4abb1
https://dts.podtrac.com/redirect.mp3/pscrb.fm/rss/p/traffic.libsyn.com/secure/coasterradio/coasterradio_115.mp3
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">orlando, florida is the theme park capital of the world. millions and millions of tourists head there every year for their vacations, but most never venture away from walt disney world or universal studios to see what else the city has to offer.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">most tourists never realize that orlando is home to a bunch of other theme park and amusement facilities that offer alternative entertainment and big-time thrills; most often at a cheaper price than the big guys.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">on this week's show, we'll talk about some of our favorite orlando attractions including gatorland, cypress gardens, and old town's g-force.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">we'll also be joined by kelly monaghan, the author of "universal orlando" and "the other orlando". he's visited every attraction there is in orlando, so he knows more than the locals do! he'll tell us about some lesser-known attractions that don't show up on the average tourist's radar.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">we'll also give away another clue in our soundwave contest and we'll have an orlando-inspired version of theme park trivia.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">thanks for listening to coasterradio.com!</p>

coasterradio.com #114 - live from paramount's kings dominion
live from paramount's kings dominion
mon, 01 aug 2005 02:32:00 +0000
96cb8b8bbadedcecbe1fe0a2df94cab4

<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">this week, coasterradio.com broadcasts live from international street at paramount's kings dominion.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">if you've listened to our show for any amount of time, you already know that kings dominion is our home park. this year, they're celebrating their 30th anniversary.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">so, we'll spend some time talking about our favorite rides and memories from pkd's past 30 years. we'll be joined by sarah lovejoy, pkd's public relations operations manager. she'll help us out as we talk about some of kings dominions' most well known roller coasters and thrill rides such as volcano: the blast coaster, flight of fear, grizzly, drop zone, rebel yell, hypersonic xlc and even some oldies like king cobra.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">we'll also spend some time reviewing their new attraction for 2005, tomb raider: firefall. this floorless top spin from huss is further enhanced by some amazing fire, water and music effects. but will it impress the coasterradio.com team?</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">we'll also review the new "school of rock" show. we've always said that shows are a waste of good riding time, but we'll make an exception to check this out. especially if the band is going to play "hot for teacher" by van halen.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">no one has guessed correctly in our latest soundwave contest yet, so we'll add another prize to the pack and give away another clue. we'll also play theme park trivia and see if the guys can answer a kings dominion related question.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">there won't be a new show next week. the whole team will betaking the week off to spend time with family and friends. but, we'll be back on monday, august 12th with a brand new show. until then, you can visit the coasterradio.com forum to talk with the coasterradio.com guys and other listeners from around the world.</p>

<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">when we first started coasterradio.com, we had no idea that people from all around the world would listen.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">we've been making friends with people in the uk, germany, france, denmark, austria and other countries throughout europe.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">so, even though we don't know a lot about europe, we're going to do our best to devote this week's show to european theme parks.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">to help us out, robb from theme park review.com will be joining us. robb, along with his wife elissa and a bunch of their friends just got back from a three week tour of european parks. they visited 25 parks in 8 different countries.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">robb will tell us about some of the unique attractions that are featured in european parks and how they compare to ones in the us. he'll also talk about how the atmosphere of their parks helps to make sure everyone has a good time.</p>

coasterradio.com #112 - disneyland's 50th anniversary
disneyland's 50th anniversary
sat, 16 jul 2005 01:04:00 +0000
9323472e1ea7ae644d147dcc6b8da530
https://dts.podtrac.com/redirect.mp3/pscrb.fm/rss/p/traffic.libsyn.com/secure/coasterradio/coasterradio_112.mp3
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">fifty years ago on july 17th, 1955...history was made.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">even if you're only a casual fan of theme parks, this is the week to pay tribute to a man who had enough imagination to turn a california orange grove into "the happiest place on earth".</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">this week, coasterradio.com celebrates disneyland's 50th anniversary and pays tribute to it's founder, walt disney.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">to help us celebrate, we'll be joined by eric jacobson, senior vice president of creative development for walt disney imagineering. eric is responsible for directing project teams developing ideas, design, content, art direction and area development for the disneyland resort in california, as well as the magic kingdom, epcot, disney-mgm studios, sports and recreation, and other entertainment venues at the walt disney world resort in florida.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">most recently, his teams have focused on many attractions opening as part of the "happiest celebration on earth" for disneyland's 50th anniversary. eric's creative leadership has shaped numerous projects, including stitch's great escape, mickey's philharmagic, buzz lightyear's space ranger spin and the twilight zone tower of terror. in addition, he has equally influenced development of many additional projects for walt disney world resort.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">also on the show this week... our "great debate" segment will ask - what is the greatest disney theme park attraction of all time? you can get into the debate by visiting our on-line forums.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">we'll also have another clue for the soundwave contest and we'll play a special disney-related version of theme park trivia.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">it's all coming up on this week's special episode of coasterradio.com.</p>

coasterradio.com #111 - waterparks
waterparks
sat, 09 jul 2005 20:25:00 +0000
5cb1f146422ba7a69c3710254d49f846
https://dts.podtrac.com/redirect.mp3/pscrb.fm/rss/p/traffic.libsyn.com/secure/coasterradio/coasterradio_111.mp3
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">we're not sure what the weather's like where you are, but here in washington, dc... it's hot!</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">so, what better way to cool off than with a coasterradio.com all about waterparks.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">back in the day, waterparks had nothing to offer but a few tame waterslides and maybe a lazy river.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">today, waterpark designers are coming up with attractions that go higher and faster than ever before. today's water rides blast you upwards, send you spinning around in circles and give you experiences that weren't available 10 years ago.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">on this week's show, we'll talk about some of the new attractions that can be found in waterparks in 2005. we'll talk about water coasters that blast you uphill. we'll talk about wave pools that pump out continuous 8 foot waves. we'll talk about the new "bowl" slides that are sweeping the nation. we'll even talk about a device called a "flow rider" that lets riders surf on a continuous stream of water.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">we'll also talk with rick root from the world waterpark association. rick's organization works with over 1,100 waterparks around the world. he'll give us the inside scoop on some of the new technologies developed to make water attractions more thrilling.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">plus, we'll have another edition of theme park trivia where one of our listeners will have a chance to win a tomb raider: firefall adventure pack courtesy of paramount's kings dominion.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">we'll also bring back our soundwave contest and give you guys a chance to win a bunch of cool prizes by guessing a roller coaster only by the sound it makes.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">also, we're unveiling two new features on our website this week.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">the first is something called the coaster radio network. we're inviting webmasters who run theme park related websites to join the network to share content and promotion.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">secondly, we're beta testing the coasterradio.com forums. many of you have been asking for ways to interact with one another. so, even though we said we'd never have message boards on coasterradio.com, we're caving in to your pressure. so, now that they're up, you'd better start posting!</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">if you have any questions, comments or suggestions for the show, e-mail us at feedback@coasterradio.com. thanks for listening to coasterradio.com.</p>

<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">also, we're unveiling two new features on our website this week.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">the first is something called the coaster radio network. we're inviting webmasters who run theme park related websites to join the network to share content and promotion.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">secondly, we're beta testing the coasterradio.com forums. many of you have been asking for ways to interact with one another. so, even though we said we'd never have message boards on coasterradio.com, we're caving in to your pressure. so, now that they're up, you'd better start posting!</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">if you have any questions, comments or suggestions for the show, e-mail us at feedback@coasterradio.com. thanks for listening to coasterradio.com.</p>

coasterradio.com #109 - theme park employees
theme park employees
fri, 24 jun 2005 02:30:00 +0000
2657cb1713cc50c08e8f7d0c19f2fa11
https://dts.podtrac.com/redirect.mp3/pscrb.fm/rss/p/traffic.libsyn.com/secure/coasterradio/coasterradio_109.mp3
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">think about the last time you visited a theme park. if it was a good trip, what made it memorable? if it was a bad trip, what made it terrible?</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">whatever type of trip you had, odds are it was affected by the employees at the park.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">think about it! were there long lines at your favorite roller coaster because the trains weren't being loaded fast enough? or were the lines constantly moving because the ride crew was challenging themselves to move as many people through the ride per hour as possible?</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">was the park clean and safe or dirty and sketchy? was the food fresh and fast or stale and slow?</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">all of these aspects of a theme park generally depend on the park's employees or "cast members".</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">on this week's coasterradio.com, we're going to pay tribute to these hard working people by sharing stories that many of them have been sending in over the past few months. we'll also share our own stories of both good and bad cast members that we have met during our theme park trips.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">we'll also play another round of theme park trivia. we'll give one of our listeners a chance to win a tomb raider: firefall adventure pack from paramount's kings dominion.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">it's all coming up this week on coasterradio.com!</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">think about the last time you visited a theme park. if it was a good trip, what made it memorable? if it was a bad trip, what made it terrible?</p>

coasterradio.com #108 - backyard thrill rides
backyard thrill rides
mon, 20 jun 2005 02:13:00 +0000
ad394e42fcf5b5acf51288caad91134c
https://dts.podtrac.com/redirect.mp3/pscrb.fm/rss/p/traffic.libsyn.com/secure/coasterradio/coasterradio_108.mp3
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">when you were a kid, did you ever dream of building a theme park in your own backyard? maybe you turned an old wagon or a big wheel into the roller coaster of your dreams?</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">this week on coasterradio.com, we'll be taking a look at three very different thrill rides that have been built in backyards across the world.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">we'll talk about a guy in germany who has created his very own log flume. we'll also talk about the blue flash, a looping, steel roller coaster that was built by a gentleman in indiana.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">but, one of our favorites is the 444-foot backyard wooden coaster built by jeremy reid. jeremy was an engineering student at the university of oklahoma and decided to use his knowledge of physics and mathematics to build his own coaster. after graduating from college, jeremy worked for arrow dynamics before they merged with s&s.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">today, jeremy works as an engineer at tinker air force base in oklahoma. we'll have him on the show to find out all about his coaster and why he wanted to build it in the first place.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">we'll also talk about the recent down-time of six flags great adventure's kingda ka. plus, we'll get into a brief discussion about whether or not there is a need for federal oversight of the amusement industry.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">we'll also play theme park trivia and give one of our listeners a chance to win a tomb raider: firefall adventure pack from paramount's kings dominion. we'll also have a phone call from our first "celebrity" listener.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">it's all coming up this week on coasterradio.com!</p>

<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">mike will re-cap his trip to las vegas. in-between sessions at the blackjack tables, mike rode the two newest attractions on top of the stratosphere tower: x-scream and insanity: the ride.</p>

coasterradio.com #102 - curse of darkastle media day
curse of darkastle media day
sat, 30 apr 2005 03:40:00 +0000
072c80ca82742017e314d698a9319254
https://dts.podtrac.com/redirect.mp3/pscrb.fm/rss/p/traffic.libsyn.com/secure/coasterradio/coasterradio_102.mp3
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;"><b>busch gardens williamsburg</b> has just unveiled their newest dark ride and it looks like it is going to be one of the top new attractions in 2005.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;"><b>"curse of darkastle: the ride"</b> is a dynamic, motion-based, 3d attraction that sends guests on a terrifying, gravity-defying ride through the mysterious corridors of a bavarian castle.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">across the country, teams of animators, engineers and designers worked for 13 months to bring this ride from concept to completion. the result is an amazing attraction that one would only expect to find in orlando theme parks.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">mike collins and flava were on hand at the media preview of<b>"darkastle."</b> instead of using their press credentials to ride the attraction with the rest of the media, they waited to ride with the general public to see what the reaction was like. in this week's show, they'll tell you all about the attraction (without giving too much away) and let you know how average park guests were reacting.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">they'll also talk with brent young of hollywood-based <b>super 78.</b> brent's company created all of the animations for this new attraction. they'll ask him about some of the technical advances that were made in the design of this ride. one of the biggest is that <b>darkastle's</b> animated scenes are digitally projected and stored on massive servers located in williamsburg. brent and his team can update the scenes in hollywood and upload them to the servers at any time. this allows scenes to be tweaked constantly and possibly even updated or replaced in the future.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">the guys also will talk to dave mauck of orlando-based <b>oceaneering.</b>dave and his team designed the motion-based ride system for <b>darkastle.</b>dave will explain how in 13 months, his team had to create intelligent ride vehicles that used "linear, circular and vertical motion" and allowed for "varying rates of acceleration."</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">in english, that means the vehicles have to give perfect rides to 1,450 people per hour all season long.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">not an easy job.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">there was no winner in last week's "soundwave" contest. we received a lot of guesses that were very close, but no one has sent in the correct answer. so, the guys will give a clue this week to help you figure it out. to hear the soundwave, listen to our first show found in the show archive section.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">speaking of the show archive, this week's show is a special episode of coasterradio.com. because of intense media demand, the entire crew was not able to attend the media event at busch gardens. so, if you are a new visitor and want to hear the show with all five hosts, head to our show archive section to listen to last week's show.</p>
<p style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;"><b>busch gardens williamsburg</b> has just unveiled their newest dark ride and it looks like it is going to be one of the top new attractions in 2005.</p>

coasterradio.com #101 - our premiere show
our premiere show
sun, 10 apr 2005 18:51:00 +0000
705249efb892a60ac06f6b5a0a466a41
https://dts.podtrac.com/redirect.mp3/pscrb.fm/rss/p/traffic.libsyn.com/secure/coasterradio/01_coasterradio_101.mp3
<p><span class="apple-style-span" style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">welcome to the premiere show of coasterradio.com!</span></p>
<p><span class="apple-style-span" style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">we'll kick off the 2005 summer season by reviewing many of the new rides and attractions that will be headed to theme parks this year. will they live up to the hype? or, will we all end up suffering from "antici-pointment?" (a combination of too much anticipation that eventually leads to disappointment.)</span></p>
<p><span class="apple-style-span" style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">we'll talk about the newest attraction to hit the las vegas strip, "insanity: the ride." we'll also talk about the major attractions coming to busch gardens (in both williamsburg and tampa).</span></p>
<p><span class="apple-style-span" style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">we'll break down the new roller coasters coming to parks like paramount's kings island, dorney park, mt. olympus water & theme park and silver dollar city. we'll also talk about six flags great adventure's new expansion. </span>we'll find out what parks guests can expect from the world's tallest and fastest roller coaster - kingda ka.</p>
<p></p>
<p><span class="apple-style-span" style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">we'll also start our series on park pet peeves. this week - what should parks and guests do about line jumpers? some parks do nothing, while others have firm policies in place. but what should the average park guest do when they are confronted by someone trying to cut in front of them? we've got some ideas that just might work.</span></p>
<p><span class="apple-style-span" style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">plus, we'll unveil our first contest, "soundwave." if you consider yourself a "theme park expert," this is the contest for you!</span></p>
<p><span class="apple-style-span" style="font-family: times; font-size: medium;">it's all coming up on this week's broadcast of "coasterradio.com."</span></p>
<p>welcome to the premiere show of coasterradio.com!</p>
<p>we'll kick off the 2005 summer season by reviewing many of the new rides and attractions that will be headed to theme parks this year. will they live up to the hype? or, will we all end up suffering from "antici-pointment?" (a combination of too much anticipation that eventually leads to disappointment.)</p>
<p>we'll talk about the newest attraction to hit the las vegas strip, "insanity: the ride." we'll also talk about the major attractions coming to busch gardens (in both williamsburg and tampa).</p>
<p>we'll break down the new roller coasters coming to parks like paramount's kings island, dorney park, mt. olympus water & theme park and silver dollar city. we'll also talk about six flags great adventure's new expansion. we'll find out what parks guests can expect from the world's tallest and fastest roller coaster - kingda ka.</p>
<p></p>
<p>we'll also start our series on park pet peeves. this week - what should parks and guests do about line jumpers? some parks do nothing, while others have firm policies in place. but what should the average park guest do when they are confronted by someone trying to cut in front of them? we've got some ideas that just might work.</p>
<p>plus, we'll unveil our first contest, "soundwave." if you consider yourself a "theme park expert," this is the contest for you!</p>
<p>it's all coming up on this week's broadcast of "coasterradio.com."</p>

coasterradio.com promo
coasterradio.com promo
fri, 01 apr 2005 21:08:00 +0000

coasterradio.com is a half-hour 
podcast dedicated to roller coasters, theme parks and thrill rides.
<p>
podcasting each week from our studios in washington, dc and from theme parks around the country, the coasterradio.com crew gets you ready for your day at the park!
